instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes does not wake from sleep
threads.message:
This machine was water damaged. ISL 6259 was replaced and battery current sensing was repaired. Overall, damage was minimal. It now passes ASD EFI without issue and runs well. Only hardware that has been changed is HDD has been replaced by non-Apple SSD. 

Sometimes, when the machine is allowed to idle for about 30 minutes, it will not wake up from sleep. It becomes completely unresponsive to normal inputs from the keyboard (including power button) and mouse. What always fixes the problem is to do an SMC reset (left shift + left option + control + power button). The machine runs completely fine other than this one problem. 

What could be causing this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes does not wake from sleep
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes does not wake from sleep
threads.message: It was corrosion on the battery light indicator. Board was fine. Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes does not wake from sleep
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> affected by corrosion then; Hall sensor is placed there...
